title: 115_s2031
content:
The "Kisatchie National Forest Land Conveyance Act" authorizes the conveyance of certain Federal land in Louisiana for market value consideration. The Act defines terms like "Collins Camp Properties" and "Secretary" for clarity. The Secretary is authorized to convey Federal land in Louisiana by quitclaim deed at public or private sale. The land includes specified parcels in Winn Parish. During a 1-year period, there is a first right of purchase. During a 1-year period, the Secretary shall convey specified Federal land in Winn Parish, Louisiana to Collins Camp Properties upon provision of consideration. This includes the Collins Campsites and another parcel of land. The Secretary may convey up to 47.92 acres of Federal land in Winn Parish, Louisiana, including the Collins Campsites and another parcel, with terms and conditions to maximize marketability or achieve management objectives. Consideration for the conveyance must be in cash. The Secretary may convey Federal land in Winn Parish, Louisiana with terms to maximize marketability or achieve management objectives. Consideration must be in cash and equal to the market value of the land determined by an appraisal approved by the Secretary. The conveyance of Federal land under this Act must be determined by an appraisal approved by the Secretary or by competitive sale. Hazardous substances disclosure is required, but the Secretary is not obligated to remediate or abate them. The Secretary must meet hazardous substances disclosure requirements but is not required to remediate or abate them. This section does not affect the application of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980 to Federal land conveyances. SEC. 5. PROCEEDS FROM THE SALE OF LAND. The Secretary will deposit proceeds from the sale of Federal land under section 4 into the fund established under Public Law 90-171 (16 U.S.C. 484a). SEC. 6. ADMINISTRATION. (a) Costs.--Upon conveyance of Federal land to Collins Camp Properties under section 4, the Secretary will require payment for appraisal costs and necessary administrative and environmental analyses.
(b) Permits.--Collins Camp Properties must provide a written statement from each holder of a Forest Service special use authorization agreeing to relinquish the authorization upon acquisition of the Federal land. The holder of a special use authorization must agree to relinquish it upon conveyance of Federal land to Collins Camp Properties. If the holder fails to provide written authorization, Collins Camp Properties will administer the authorization until it expires.
